alert.note: Alert for Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 6:39PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL NORTON COUNTY THROUGH 715 PM CDT... At 639 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southwest of Norton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Norton County, including the following locations... Densmore and Calvert. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
